title: How to Make a VIP T Shirt Door on Roblox

steps.headline: Create a barrier around your area using 4 bricks, one in the back, one in the left, one in the right, and one in the top.
steps.description: DO NOT make a front yet. Make sure that you anchor them before resizing.

steps.headline: Make a brick in the front and set the transparency to .9 or to your preference to let people see inside and witness how awesome it is and want to buy your shirt.
In Workspace, find your front brick (or use the mouse icon towards the top of the window and click on the brick) and click on it.
steps.description: The brick in the list should be fully highlighted in blue, this means that you have selected it.

steps.headline: Move you mouse cursor over to the uppermost tabs on the left.
steps.description: Click on the "Insert" tab, click on "Object", click on "Script". In Explorer Workspace double-click on the newly-added script--- it should already be highlighted in blue.

steps.headline: In the script, erase everything there [print: 'Hello World!
steps.description:
'], then paste this in:
print ("VIP T-Shirt Door Script Loaded")
-- list of account names allowed to go through the door. permission = { "YourNameHere" } -- This is how many people can still get through, so you don't have to change shirts. You can also have another friend here. -- Texture of the VIP shirt. texture = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?version=1&id=1194117" -- Go to the wiki below this script to find out how to change the shirt. And paste the link in between the "" marks. function checkOkToLetIn(name)
for i = 1,#permission do
-- convert strings to all uppercase, otherwise we will let in
-- "Username" but not "username" or "uSERNAME"
if (string.upper(name) == string.upper(permission[i])) then return true end
end
return false
end
local Door = script.Parent
function onTouched(hit)
print("Door Hit")
local human = hit.Parent:findFirstChild("Humanoid")
if (human ~= nil ) then
if human.Parent.Torso.roblox.Texture == texture then --the shirt
Door.Transparency = 0.7
Door.CanCollide = false
wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open
Door.CanCollide = true
Door.Transparency = 0
-- a human has touched this door! print("Human touched door")
-- test the human's name against the permission list
elseif (checkOkToLetIn(human.Parent.Name)) then
print("Human passed test")
Door.Transparency = 0.7
Door.CanCollide = false
wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open
Door.CanCollide = true
Door.Transparency = 0
else human.Health = 0 -- delete this line of you want a non-killing VIP door
end
end
end
script.Parent.Touched:connect(onTouched)

steps.headline: To get a shirt for your place, you must be wearing the shirt you want to be the VIP one.
In Properties, copy an address that looks like a web address next to "Texture".
steps.description:
Open the script, and paste that address where the script tells you to. (In between the "" marks, in place of the address that's there.) You can now sell your shirt, if you are in Builders Club, that is. I would test the door online to make sure the door works before you advertise the shirt. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: In the script, it is strongly suggested to replace YourNameHere with your username inside the "" in line 4.
Save and exit the build.
steps.description: Test the door out in Play mode. If it still doesn't work, you can get real official help from:

tyn: Roblox (a downloadable, free program, if you paid, DEMAND A REFUND!!)
text:
Create a barrier around your area using 4 bricks, one in the back, one in the left, one in the right, and one in the top. DO NOT make a front yet. Make sure that you anchor them before resizing. Make a brick in the front and set the transparency to .9 or to your preference to let people see inside and witness how awesome it is and want to buy your shirt. In Workspace, find your front brick (or use the mouse icon towards the top of the window and click on the brick) and click on it. The brick in the list should be fully highlighted in blue, this means that you have selected it. Move you mouse cursor over to the uppermost tabs on the left. Click on the "Insert" tab, click on "Object", click on "Script". In Explorer Workspace double-click on the newly-added script--- it should already be highlighted in blue. In the script, erase everything there [print: 'Hello World! '], then paste this in: print ("VIP T-Shirt Door Script Loaded") -- list of account names allowed to go through the door. permission = { "YourNameHere" } -- This is how many people can still get through, so you don't have to change shirts. You can also have another friend here. -- Texture of the VIP shirt. texture = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?version=1&id=1194117" -- Go to the wiki below this script to find out how to change the shirt. And paste the link in between the "" marks. function checkOkToLetIn(name) for i = 1,#permission do -- convert strings to all uppercase, otherwise we will let in -- "Username" but not "username" or "uSERNAME" if (string.upper(name) == string.upper(permission[i])) then return true end end return false end local Door = script.Parent function onTouched(hit) print("Door Hit") local human = hit.Parent:findFirstChild("Humanoid") if (human ~= nil ) then if human.Parent.Torso.roblox.Texture == texture then --the shirt Door.Transparency = 0.7 Door.CanCollide = false wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open Door.CanCollide = true Door.Transparency = 0 -- a human has touched this door! print("Human touched door") -- test the human's name against the permission list elseif (checkOkToLetIn(human.Parent.Name)) then print("Human passed test") Door.Transparency = 0.7 Door.CanCollide = false wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open Door.CanCollide = true Door.Transparency = 0 else human.Health = 0 -- delete this line of you want a non-killing VIP door end end end script.Parent.Touched:connect(onTouched) To get a shirt for your place, you must be wearing the shirt you want to be the VIP one. Then you must visit your place in Build Solo mode. Then: Go to View > Explorer, then the Explorer will pop up on the side of your screen. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/11\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/11\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

I would test the door online to make sure the door works before you advertise the shirt. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bf\/Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-VIP-T-Shirt-Door-on-Roblox-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

sentences: Create a barrier around your area using 4 bricks, one in the back, one in the left, one in the right, and one in the top.
DO NOT make a front yet.
Make sure that you anchor them before resizing.
Make a brick in the front and set the transparency to .9 or to your preference to let people see inside and witness how awesome it is and want to buy your shirt.
In Workspace, find your front brick (or use the mouse icon towards the top of the window and click on the brick) and click on it.
The brick in the list should be fully highlighted in blue, this means that you have selected it.
Move you mouse cursor over to the uppermost tabs on the left.
Click on the "Insert" tab, click on "Object", click on "Script".
In Explorer Workspace double-click on the newly-added script--- it should already be highlighted in blue.
In the script, erase everything there [print: 'Hello World!

'], then paste this in:
print ("VIP T-Shirt Door Script Loaded")
-- list of account names allowed to go through the door.
permission = { "YourNameHere" } -- This is how many people can still get through, so you don't have to change shirts.
You can also have another friend here.
-- Texture of the VIP shirt.
texture = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?version=1&id=1194117" -- Go to the wiki below this script to find out how to change the shirt.
And paste the link in between the "" marks.

function checkOkToLetIn(name)
for i = 1,#permission do
-- convert strings to all uppercase, otherwise we will let in
-- "Username" but not "username" or "uSERNAME"
if (string.upper(name) == string.upper(permission[i])) then return true end
end
return false
end
local Door = script.Parent
function onTouched(hit)
print("Door Hit")
local human = hit.Parent:findFirstChild("Humanoid")
if (human ~= nil ) then
if human.Parent.Torso.roblox.Texture == texture then --the shirt
Door.Transparency = 0.7
Door.CanCollide = false
wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open
Door.CanCollide = true
Door.Transparency = 0
-- a human has touched this door!

print("Human touched door")
-- test the human's name against the permission list
elseif (checkOkToLetIn(human.Parent.Name)) then
print("Human passed test")
Door.Transparency = 0.7
Door.CanCollide = false
wait(4) -- this is how long the door is open
Door.CanCollide = true
Door.Transparency = 0
else human.Health = 0 -- delete this line of you want a non-killing VIP door
end
end
end
script.Parent.Touched:connect(onTouched) To get a shirt for your place, you must be wearing the shirt you want to be the VIP one.
Then you must visit your place in Build Solo mode.

Then:
Go to View > Explorer, then the Explorer will pop up on the side of your screen.
